captions.text:
Darkness has come for Lordran. In the darkness,
primeval man has fathered a lightless Abyss

and his rage influences the people of Oolacile;
driving their humanity wild and corrupting

their essence. Humanity is necessary to perpetuate
the life of fire; Gwyn has no choice but to

deal with the abomination of Oolacile. Artorias
is chosen to confront the creatures of the

Abyss. One of Gwyn's four elite warriors known
for a will of unbendable steel; a characteristic

forged by his personal quest for glory. Eager
to test his mettle, Artorias departs Anor

Londo with all needed by a true warrior: a
trustworthy comrade and a blade tempered with

a strength equal to the challenges that lie
ahead.

Artorias, the great knight of Gwyn, stormed
Oolacile. The warrior's weapon unstoppable.

Artorias admired the keen craftsmenship of
his deadly blade. It was an extension of his being;

cleaving many foes with a single, effortless
motion. Gwyn's firstborn, the god of War,

would be proud of Artorias this day, for his
spirit was one of battle. A balance; a harmony

of strength, faith and wisdom had crafted
Artorias into a devastating weapon of Lordran.

Artorias almost felt sympathy for his foes,
but they were disciples of darkness now.
With the fearsome speed of gods, Artorias had carved through the city and deep into the darkness below.

The great knight and his faithful companion
Sif stood at the precipice, Primeval Man below;

worn by battle and corroded by the taint of
the Abyss. They were ready.
The light clashed with the dark.

The combat between the powers
raged, the earth itself trembled in the wake of their might.

In the onslaught, the Father
of the Abyss was defeated and so born was

the Legend of Artorias the Abysswalker.
The legend of Artorias art none but a fabrication.

The denizens of Lordran believe this legend;
this parable of Artorias the Abysswalker;

Artorias the warrior who risked everything
in the name of light and defeated the dark.

But Truth; truth is not so easy to come by
in Lordran. So many have been led to believe

such fables or they choose to believe; they
want to believe in something. The truth is:

Artorias never slew darkwraith, same as he
never laid waste to Manus, Father of the Abyss.

The truth is, The Legend of Artorias has been
misconstrued and lost in time; a reflection

of Oolacile's fate.
That is, until time itself was penetrated;

clenching a warrior from the distant future;
pulled through a millennia of life and death

and, of course, light and dark, to Oolacile
in its darkest hour; to Artorias' darkest hour.

That warrior was the Chosen Undead,
fitting it would seem Artorias was ignorant to that fact.

But Artorias remembers well
the warrior that passed through the threshold of the coliseum.
Whatever thou art... stay away.
Soon I will be consumed by them, by the dark.
Artorias can hear himself warning the warrior; advising to tread no farther,
but the words never leave his mouth. It is too late.

The darkness is overtaking him, he can feel it
now; coddling his soul.
With his last unblackend moment,

Artorias remembers; he remembers how
everything went wrong. How the Father of the

Abyss took everything from him; his pride,
his glory... his faith;
all corroded away by the darkness.
Artorias; ashamed of what he is becoming -- a puppet of the Abyss.
I beg of thee: the spread of the Abyss must be stopped!
Flee, if art able.

Manus allowed Artorias to live; left him to
become an advocate of darkness; an example

of the fate awaiting those who challenge the
Abyss. Corroded and broken, Artorias struggled the surface;
hoping to return with aid.

All of you. Forgive me, for I have availed
you nothing!

Lost in his memories: Artorias is enraged
at what he has become. The furry of his failure

consume the Abysswalker. All that matters
now is the anger. Anger and darkness.
Everything is black now.
Envloped in darkness, screaming, mad and out of control.

The shadow that was once Artorias
is struck down by the Chosen Undead.

The same warrior would go on to slay the Father of
the Abyss mistaken as Artorias; solidifying

the foundation on which built the Legend of
the Abysswalker.

There are always more than one truth. Fact
and fabrication,
the reality of what we want to believe as truth,
the reality of the actual truth,
or the reality ignorant to us.

It doesn't matter what you choose to believe;
the legend or the forgotten truth.

What matters is what we do with the time allotted.
And no matter the reality, the truth is Artorias

was a warrior who fought for what he believed
was right. Like so many others of Lordran,
he fought for what he believed was worth dying for.

The reality of legends is that they're bigger
than the truth. And the truth is: what's under

that mask is not mortal. No, under that mask
is a legend; immortal.
A champion of the Gods.
A dear friend.
A companion.
An Ideal.
That can never be broken or corroded by the Abyss

title: Dark Souls Lore: The Legend of Artorias the Abysswalker
